title: Polydactyl cats!
content:
I found this cool thing at Wikipedia today:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polydactyl_cat]en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polydactyl_cat[/url]

They're like normal cats, but they have more toes in their paws than normal cats have. Because of that they are able to climb better and for example open boxes and stuff. The pawns have sort of thumb in them. See pictures:
[url=http://www.thecatgallery.com/polydactyl_cats.html]www.thecatgallery.com/pol..._cats.html[/url]Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Polydactyl cats!
content:

title: Re: Polydactyl cats!
content:
Its an interesting note that in nearly all species 5 active digits is optimum, 4 and 3 are less efficient but still tolerable, but 6 or more causes serious deformities.

It makes you wonder if alien life would develop six fingers or stick with 5 or less. After examining several vorticons, a Bloog and KeenRush, I'd go for the latter.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord
